[[File:EM base damage level scaling updated (March 2022).png|thumb|right|300px|Base damage from Transformative Reactions per Level<br /><br />'''Note''' Data from [[Version 1.6]] and later.]]

The character's level and enemy's level affects the damage dealt or received, as well as the strength of the shield generated from a {{Color|Geo|Crystallize}} reaction.

For [[Crystallize]], the base shield HP is determined by the '''Crystallize Shield Level Multiplier'''.

For [[Damage#Transformative Reaction Damage|Transformative Reactions]], the base damage is determined by '''Reaction Multiplier''' and '''Element Level Multiplier'''.

For certain types environmental damage such as those dealt by [[Thunderstone]]s, the base damage is determined by '''Environmental Damage Multiplier''' and '''Element Level Multiplier'''.

The level scaling curves for the two Level Multipliers are both irregular functions.

The values in the following tables are rounded to one or two decimal places. Actual values used in the game have greater precision, so using the table values for calculation will often result in some small rounding errors. However, the displayed damage numbers in game are '''rounded down''' to integers.

==Transformative Reaction Base Damage==
For calculation,

<math>\text{Base Damage} = \text{Reaction Multiplier} \times\ \text{Element Level Multiplier}</math>

Note: These refer to the same '''Reaction Multiplier''' and '''Level Multiplier''' terminologies as used in the article on [[Damage#Transformative Reaction Damage|Transformative Reaction Damage]].

===Reaction Multiplier===
The reaction multipliers can be derived from internal data.

{| class="article-table"
!Reaction !! Reaction Multiplier
|-
| [[Burning]] || 0.25
|-
| [[Superconduct]] || 0.5
|-
| [[Swirl]] || 0.6
|-
| [[Electro-Charged]] || 1.2
|-
| [[Shattered]] || 1.5
|-
| [[Overloaded]] || 2
|}

Most community-derived Transformative Reaction Damage sheets prefer using Superconduct as the baseline (i.e., Superconduct has a multiplier of 1). The following damage multipliers are '''equivalent''' reaction multipliers.

{| class="article-table"
!Reaction !! Equivalent Reaction Multiplier
|-
| [[Burning]] || 0.5
|-
| [[Superconduct]] || 1
|-
| [[Swirl]] || 1.2
|-
| [[Electro-Charged]] || 2.4
|-
| [[Shattered]] || 3
|-
| [[Overloaded]] || 4
|}

==Environmental Base Damage==
For calculation,

<math>\text{Base Damage} = \text{Environmental Damage Multiplier} \times\ \text{Element Level Multiplier}</math>
